data.title: Southwest Airlines Reported $-908 Mil Q4 Net Income, Up $249 Mil (-22%) QoQ, Driven By Revenue Change
data.meta_description:
Revenue increased by $220 Mil (12%) Q/Q and decreased by $-3,717 Mil (-65%) Y/Y. Total Costs & Operating Expenses decreased by $-21 Mil (-0.6%) Q/Q and decreased by $-1,801 Mil (-35%) Y/Y. BREAKING DOWN TOTAL COSTS & OPERATING EXPENSE CHANGE

Below we highlight key expense factors related to the change in Total Costs & Operating Expenses of $-21 Mil Q/Q and of $-1,801 Mil Y/Y. Non-Operating Income / (Expense) decreased by $-30 Mil (97%) Q/Q and decreased by $-81 Mil (-405%) Y/Y. Q/Q Net Income increased by $249 Mil (-22%) to $-908 Mil in 2020Q4 from $-1,157 Mil in 2020Q3. null ...d by ... (...) Q/Q and ...d by ... (...) Y/Y. BREAKING DOWN Q/Q NET INCOME CHANGE

Below we look at the revenue and expense factors that drove the quarter-over-quarter change in Net Income of $249 Mil. Tax Expense decreased by $0 Mil (0.0%) Q/Q and decreased by $-153 Mil (-100%) Y/Y.
